meanings.definition: Train (a tree or shrub) to grow flat against a wall or trellis.
meanings.sent1: She espaliered the apple tree along the garden wall.
meanings.sent2: The gardener espaliered the rose bushes to create a beautiful display.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to espalier itself against the fence, thinking it was a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her determination espaliered her dreams against all odds, like a tree clinging to a rocky cliff.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight espaliered through the branches, casting intricate patterns on the ground.

meanings.definition: A tree or shrub that has been trained to grow flat against a wall or trellis.
meanings.sent1: The garden featured a lovely espaliered pear tree.
meanings.sent2: Visitors admired the intricate design of the espaliered cherry tree.
meanings.sent3: The espaliered apple tree seemed to wink at passersby, as if in on a secret joke.
meanings.sent4: The espaliered fig tree stood like a sentinel, guarding the entrance to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The ancient espaliered olive tree whispered stories of the past to those who listened.
